title.narrative: Scale-up access to integrated Sexual and Reproductive Health, including Gender Based Violence information and services for women and girls affected by the crisis in ten prioritized counties of South Sudan

description.narrative: The objective of this project is to support the scale-up of access to integrated SRH, including GBV information and services for women and girls affected by the crisis in ten prioritized counties of South Sudan. The project also benefits the caretakers of young people in and out of schools and complements UNHCR’s protection project, UNICEF’s education project and IOM’s project for persons with disabilities. The current project has three overarching objectives covering SRH, GBV and prevention of sexual exploitation and abuse (PSEA). This project directly targets 31,600 individuals, among whom are nearly 5% people with various disabilities, and nearly 20% girls and 17% boys in and out of schools in Akobo, Pibor, Aweil South, Tonji South, Tonji Noth, Tonji East, Duk, Bor South, Ayod and Twic East, with lifesaving SRH and GBV services.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SOUTH SUDAN UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES VIOLENCE/CLASHES 2021

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Increased access to GBV services and information, including materials for dignity for girls and women. This objective will benefit 27,500 individuals, mainly women and girls, and boys and men in all ten target counties
Number of GBV actors benefitting from refresher training
Number of individuals reached with GBV awareness messages in the ten counties
Number of women and girls served with dignity kits
Number of women and girls served with integrated GBV services at OSCs and WGFS

Increased access to SRH services and information, including the availability of reproductive health supplies to all partners offering reproductive health services in the ten priority counties. This objective will benefit 30,250 individuals; women, girls, boys and men in all ten target counties.
Number of health workers benefiting from a refresher on various forms of reproductive health services.
Number of individuals reached with other forms of reproductive health services including family planning , STDs treatment, PMTCT, ANC, and others
Number of women reached with basic and comprehensive emergency obstetric care only.
